intro: Crinum undulatum, commonly known as the wavy crinum, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It produces multiple flowering stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, making it a striking ornamental plant. Crinum undulatum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
